alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 2:26PM MDT until August 02 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Utah, including the following county, Salt Lake. * WHEN...Until 330 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas, including roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rainfall has been focused in West Valley city. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Murray, West Jordan, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Midvale, South Salt Lake, Kearns, Oquirrh, Magna, Salt Lake City International Airport, Millcreek, Bingham Canyon Mine and Copperton.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
